name: Alima
headline: Fresh procurement made easy
description: Alima is a supply chain tech company that simplifies how businesses procure fresh goods in Latin America. We help restaurants, CPG brands, and retailers plan their buying orders, ordering products, expense management, and logistics.

founders.name: Jorge Vizcayno, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder & CEO of Alima
Prev: Head of Tech at ByPrice.com, +5 years developing software solutions, and leading data & engineering teams.  Founded Tuibo, a smart garment for cyclists. Former Robotics Lecturer at UNAM, and RA in Deep RL at CLVR Lab, USC.

founders.name: Blanca Espinosa, Founder
founders.description: I have +15 years experience working for big companies and startups (Coca Cola FEMSA, Amazon, Uber). Background on Growth, Mkt, BD and CX. My passion is to build high performing teams, beat targets and achieve great results together. MBA in Escuela Europea de Direcci√≥n y Empresa (Spain), founder of Equal at Uber (social class ERG) and I‚Äôm a mom since August 2021!

generated_description:
Alima is a supply chain tech company revolutionizing the way businesses procure fresh goods across Latin America. Founded in 2021 and a proud participant in Y Combinator's W22 batch, Alima simplifies procurement for restaurants, consumer packaged goods (CPG) brands, and retailers. Their mission, "Fresh procurement made easy," reflects their aim to streamline the complexities of ordering fresh products, managing expenses, and overseeing logistics.

Headquartered in the vibrant Mexico City, Alima operates with a lean team of 10 dedicated employees. They have established a network of partnerships to enhance their platform's capabilities, namely with their group partner, Nan.

The services offered by Alima are diverse, focusing on providing a robust e-commerce platform for food service providers. Features include personalized online stores, real-time reporting, automated invoicing, inventory management, and integrations with enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. These tools empower suppliers and distributors to optimize their operations and expand their client base.

As of now, Alima is categorized primarily in the B2B and logistics sectors, underlining its commitment to serving businesses rather than individual consumers. The company has garnered attention from notable media outlets, including TechCrunch and Business Insider Mexico, showcasing its impact on the supply chain landscape.

In essence, Alima is not just about procurement; it's about empowering food service providers with the tools to elevate their sales and streamline their operations efficiently. If scaling your business is on your agenda, Alima seems like the partner you're looking for. You can check them out at their website [here](https://alima.la).
